translations.@config_system_enable_logging_descriptio: Specify whether to enable log output. System initialization logs for Automatics are always output regardless of the value of this option.
translations.@config_system_log_level_to_allow_loggin: Specify the log level that allows logging.
translations.@config_system_resources_directory_descr:
[This option will be discontinued in the near future. Check the README for details]
Specify the absolute path of the directory where your custom translation files and resources such as custom map icons are stored. If a valid value is specified for this option, the default resource directory (the same directory as Automations.dll) is followed by the resources stored in this directory.
translations.@config_general_custom_animal_descriptio:
Any animal can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the animal. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the internal name of the animal. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_dungeon_descripti:
Any dungeon can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the dungeon. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the prefab name of the dungeon. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_flora_description:
Any flora can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the flora. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the internal name of the flora. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_mineral_descripti:
Any mineral can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the mineral. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the internal name of the mineral. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_monster_descripti:
Any monster can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the monster. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the internal name of the monster. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_spawner_descripti:
Any spawner can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the spawner. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the internal name of the spawner. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_spot_description:
Any spot can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the spot. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the prefab name of the spot. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_door_description:
Any door can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the door. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the internal name of the door. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_vehicle_descripti:
Any vehicle can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the vehicle. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the prefab name of the vehicle. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_other_description:
Any object can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the object. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the internal or prefab name of the object. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_general_custom_container_descrip:
Any container can be added.
Identifier: a unique string that does not overlap with any other identifier. White spaces are not allowed.
Label: The name of the container. Mainly used in GUI. If you specify an internal name, it will be translated automatically.
Pattern: A pattern matching the internal or prefab name of the container. Exact matches are evaluated. You can set a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning.
translations.@config_automatic_door_enable_automatic_: Specify whether to enable the feature that automatically opens and closes the door.
translations.@config_automatic_door_allow_automatic_d: Specify which doors are allowed to open and close automatically.

Specify the display or internal name of any door that is allowed to open and close automatically. A display name is a name displayed in the game, such as "Wood door", and the specified value will enable the automatic door if it partially matches the target display name. The internal name is the name used on the program side, such as "$piece_wooddoor", and the specified value must exactly match the target's internal name for the automatic door to be enabled.
translations.@config_automatic_door_interval_to_open_: Specify the interval at which the process of automatically opening the door is called. If set to less than 0.1, the function to automatically open the door will be disabled. (Unit: second)
translations.@config_automatic_door_interval_to_close: Specify the interval at which the process of automatically closing the door is called. If set to less than 0.1, the function to automatically close the door will be disabled. (Unit: second)
translations.@config_automatic_door_distance_for_auto: Specify how close the player must be to the door in order for it to open automatically. (Unit: meter)
Specify how far the player must be from the door for the door to close automatically. (Unit: meter)
translations.@config_automatic_door_automatic_door_en: Specify a shortcut key to enable/disable the automatic door.
Specify where a message is displayed when the automatic door is enabled or disabled by a shortcut key.
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_enable_automat: Specify whether to enable the feature that automatically pinning objects and locations to the map.
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_dynamic_object: Specify the range of dynamic objects to be explored. "Dynamic Object" are objects that change position, such as animals, monsters, etc. Set to 0 to disable pinning of dynamic objects. (Unit: meter)
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_static_object_: Specify the range of static objects to be explored. "Static Object" are objects that do not change their position, such as flora, mineral, etc. Setting this to 0 disables pinning of static objects. (Unit: meter)
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_location_mappi: Specify the range of location to be explored. "Location" is a specific place, such as dungeon, fuling village, etc. Setting this to 0 disables location pinning. (Unit: meter)
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_allow_pinning_: Allow Pinning Animal
Specify the animals to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Monster
Specify the monsters to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Flora
Specify the flora to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Mineral
Specify the mineral to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Spawner
Specify the spawners to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Vehicle
Specify the vehicles to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Other Object
Specify the other objects to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Dungeon
Specify the dungeons to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Spot
Specify the spots to be automatic pinning.
Allow Pinning Portal
Enable automatic pinning for the portal. Portal is treated as a static object.
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_not_pinning_ta: Exclude tamed animals from automatic pinning.
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_static_object_: Specify the interval at which static object mapping. Setting to 0 disables periodic static object mapping. (Unit: second)
Specify the interval at which static objects will be cached. Mapping of static objects uses this cache. (Unit: second)
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_save_static_ob: Specify whether to save the pins of static objects.
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_remove_pins_of: Specify whether or not to automatically remove pins of objects that have been destroyed and no longer exist.
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_flora_pins_mer: When pinning flora, it recursively searches for the same flora that exist within a specified range and merge them into a single pin. (Unit: meter)
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_need_to_equip_: Need To Equip Wishbone For Underground Minerals
Specify whether the wishbone needs to be equipped to attempt to pinning underground minerals.
translations.@config_automatic_mapping_static_object_: Specify shortcut keys for mapping static objects. Setting this item disables the static object mapping at regular intervals, so that it is performed only once each time the shortcut key is pressed.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_enable_auto: Specify whether to enable or disable the ability to automatically perform tasks such as cooking, refining, and refuel.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_allow_conta: Specify containers that allow automatic operations such as item supply and storage.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_allow_proce: Specify the automatic processes to allow for $1. "Craft" produces items by automatically consuming the required materials. "Refuel" automatically supplies fuel items. "Store" automatically stores the produced items in containers. "Charge" automatically replenishes consumable items such as ammo.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_container_s: Specifies the maximum distance $1 will search for containers. (Unit: meters)
translations.@config_automatic_processing_material_co: $1: Number Of Materials To Stop Supplying

When the number of material items stored in the container is about to become less than the specified quantity, the supply of materials to $1 will be stopped. If set to 0, stopping the material supply based on the number of material items will be disabled.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_supply_only: $1: Supply Only If Materials Run Out
Supply one material item only when the materials supplied to $1 run out.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_fuel_count_: $1: Number Of Fuels To Stop Refuel

When the number of fuel items stored in the container is about to become less than the specified quantity, refuel to $1 will be stopped. If set to 0, stopping refuel based on the number of fuel items will be disabled.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_product_sta: $1: Number Of Product Stacks To Stop Craft

When the number of product item stacks stored in the container is about to exceed the specified quantity, craft by $1 will be stopped. If set to 0, stopping craft based on the number of product items will be disabled.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_refuel_only: Refuel only when material items are supplied to $1.
$1: Refuel Only If Fuels Run Out
Refuel only when the fuel for $1 runs out.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_store_only_: $1: Store Only If Product Exists In Container
Store only if the product item for $1 is already stored in the container. If there is no container in the range that stores product items, items are produced as usual.
translations.@config_automatic_processing_number_of_i: $1: Number Of Items To Stop Charge

When the number of items stored in the container is about to become less than the specified quantity, charge to $1 will be stopped. If set to 0, stopping charge based on the number of items will be disabled.
translations.@config_automatic_feeding_enable_automat: Specify whether to enable the feature for animals to automatically consume feed items from players and containers.
translations.@config_automatic_feeding_feed_search_ra: Specify the range in which the animal searches for food. If set to 0, the default value for each animal will be used. (Unit: meter)
translations.@config_automatic_feeding_need_get_close: Need Get Close To Eat The Feed
Specify whether the animal needs to approach the container or player to eat the feed.
translations.@config_automatic_feeding_allow_to_feed_: Specify the types of animals allowed to feed from the container.
Specify the types of animals allowed to feed from the player inventory.
translations.@config_automatic_repair_enable_automati: Specify whether to enable the feature that automatically repair items and pieces.
translations.@config_automatic_repair_crafting_statio: Specify the range to search for a crafting station to be used to repair items. Setting to 0 disables periodic item repair. (Unit: meters)
translations.@config_automatic_repair_repair_items_wh: Repair Items When Accessing The Crafting Station
Specify whether or not to repair all items that can be repaired when the workbench GUI is opened.
translations.@config_automatic_repair_item_repair_mes: Specify where the message is displayed when an item is repaired.
translations.@config_automatic_repair_piece_search_ra: Specify the range to search for a pieces to repair. Setting to 0 disables periodic pieces repairs. (Unit: meters)
translations.@config_automatic_repair_piece_repair_me: Specify where the message is displayed when a piece is repaired.
translations.@config_automatic_mining_enable_automati: Specify whether to enable the feature that mine minerals automatically.
translations.@config_automatic_mining_need_to_equip_p: Need To Equip Pickaxe For Mining

Specify whether a pickaxe needs to be equipped to attempt automatic mining. Disabling this option will use the most advanced pickaxe in the player's inventory. If there is no pickaxe in the player's inventory, automatic mining will not be attempted.
translations.@config_automatic_mining_mining_interval: Specify the interval between mining attempts. (Unit: seconds)
translations.@config_automatic_mining_mining_range_de: Specify the maximum distance to search for a mineral. Setting to 0 the pickaxe's attack range is used. (Unit: meters)
translations.@config_automatic_mining_allow_mining_mi: Specify the minerals to be automatically mined.
translations.@config_automatic_mining_allow_mining_un: Specify whether or not to allow mining underground minerals.
translations.@config_automatic_mining_need_to_equip_w: Need To Wishbone For Mining Underground Minerals
Specify whether or not to require a wishbone to mine underground minerals.
translations.@config_automatic_mining_mining_key_desc: Specify a shortcut key to attempt mining. If a valid shortcut key is assigned to this option, mining at regular intervals is disabled.
translations.@config_automatic_pickup_automatic_picku: Specify the range within which objects are automatically pickup. (Unit: meters)
Specify the interval within which objects are automatically pickup. Setting it to 0 disables periodic automatic pickup. (Unit: second)
translations.@config_automatic_pickup_pickup_all_near: Interacting with pickable objects using this key makes it possible to pick up the same object in a range at once. If a valid shortcut key is assigned to this option, pickup at regular intervals is disabled.
translations.@config_common_disable_module_descriptio: You can disable this feature completely to avoid adding logic you don't need. (Game must be restart for reflect this option)
translations.@command_common_help_description: Displays a help message and exits the command.
translations.@command_automatics_description: Displays the usage of commands added by Automatics.
translations.@command_automatics_option_include_descr: Show only commands whose names include the word specified in this option.
translations.@command_automatics_option_exclude_descr: Exclude commands whose names contain the word specified with this option.
translations.@command_automatics_option_verbose_descr: Displays detailed usage of the command.
translations.@command_printnames_description: Outputs internal or display names that contain the specified string or match the specified regular expression. If multiple arguments are specified, only those matching all of them will be output.
translations.@command_printnames_extra_option:
WORD:   A text contained in the internal or display name. (e.g. $enemy_, $item_, $piece_, Boar, Mushroom, Wood door); All partially matching internal and display names are output.
REGEXP: A regular expression of the internal or display name to be output. Must be prefixed with r/ (e.g. r/^[$]item_, r/^boar$)
translations.@command_printnames_extra_description:
Examples:
printnames ling r/^[$]enemy_
printnames r/^[$@]location_.+(?<!_(enter|exit))$
printnames mushroom r/^[$]item_.+(?<!_description)$
translations.@command_printobjects_description: Display objects that can be handled by Automatics in the nearby.
translations.@command_printobjects_extra_option: TYPE: Type of object to be displayed. Specify one of the following: animal, container, door, dungeon, flora, mineral, monster, spawner, spot, vehicle, other.
translations.@command_printobjects_option_radius_desc: Specify the range within which the object is to be searched. [Default: 32] (Unit: Meters)
translations.@command_printobjects_option_number_desc: Specify how many objects matching the condition are to be displayed. [Default: 4]
translations.@command_printobjects_option_include_des: Show only objects whose internal or display names match the word specified in this option. It works as a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning of the string.
translations.@command_printobjects_option_exclude_des: Exclude objects whose internal names or display names match the word specified with this option. It works as a regular expression by concatenating r/ at the beginning of the string.
translations.@command_printobjects_extra_description: Note: The result of this command may show objects that you feel are not of the target type. For example, a Flint appear in the Flora search. This is not a bug but means that Automatics can treat Flint as Flora.
translations.@command_printobjects_message_result_mor: In addition to this, found $1 types of objects that can be treated as $2.
translations.@command_printobjects_message_result_emp: No $1 matching the criteria were found.
translations.@command_removemappins_description: Remove the map pins that match the specified conditions. By default, it runs in safe mode and only removes duplicate pins. [Caution] To prevent accidental actions, please temporarily disable the 'Automatic Mapping' when using this command.
translations.@command_removemappins_option_radius_des: Specify the maximum distance from the player's position to the pin to be removed. If set to 0, all pins will be targeted. [Default: 0] (Unit: meters)
translations.@command_removemappins_option_include_de: Pins that contain the specified string in their name will be targeted for deletion.
translations.@command_removemappins_option_exclude_de: Pins that contain the specified string in their name will be excluded from the deletion target.
translations.@command_removemappins_option_dry_run_de: Enables the dry run mode. When this option is specified, pin deletion will be skipped, and only text output to the console will be performed.
translations.@command_removemappins_option_dangerous_: When this option is specified, non-duplicate pins will also be included in the deletion target. Please use this option with caution, as incorrect usage can result in the deletion of all pins on the map.
translations.@command_removemappins_message_safe_mode: The removemappins command is currently being executed in safe mode. To completely remove pins from the map, you need to enable the "dangerous-mode" option. For more details, please run "removemappins -h" to refer to the help.
